plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial flowering plant that produces cup-shaped flowers, often one of the first to bloom signaling the arrival of spring in temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers are known for their vibrant colors and are sometimes confused with early blooming tulips.

plants.name: Prunus mume
plants.description: A deciduous tree prized for its fragrant and early blooming pink to white flowers, often blooming in late winter to early spring in East Asia.
plants.funFact: Prunus mume blossoms are celebrated in East Asian cultures for their beauty and symbolism of resilience amid winter.

plants.name: Banksia ericifolia
plants.description: A native Australian shrub producing striking orange-red inflorescences shaped like cylindrical flower spikes, attracting birds and pollinators.
plants.funFact: Banksias have woody seed cones that open after fire or dry conditions, helping regeneration after bushfires.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A deciduous hybrid tree ornamental for its large, tulip-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaf emergence.
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolia flowers can be quite large, measuring up to 20 cm across, and emit a mild, pleasant fragrance.
